column1: So the shepherd set out for home
column2: and on his way through the wood
column3: he heard and understood all that was said by the birds
column4: and by every living creature. When he got back to his sheep
column5: he found the flock grazing peacefully
column6: and as he was very tired
column7: he laid himself down by them to rest a little. Hardly had he done so when two ravens flew down and perched on a tree nearby
column8: and began to talk to each other in their own language: ‘If that shepherd only knew that there is a vault full of gold and silver beneath where that lamb is lying
column9: what would he not do?' When the shepherd heard these words
column10: he went straight to his master and told him
column11: and the master at once took a wagon and broke open the door of the vault
column12: and they carried off the treasure.
